Title: APPLICATION OF ASSISTED REALITY AT MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES: E-REDES' PILOT PROJECT RESULTS
Authors: Bernardo Almeida, João M. Bolas, Ricardo J. Santos, João M. Teodoro, João Bento, Luís Matos, Eduardo Romão, Filipe Guerreiro
Venue: CIRED 2021 - The 26th International Conference and Exhibition on Electricity Distribution
Abstract summary: A pilot project evaluated the use of assisted reality technology for utility field maintenance activities.

Title: GridSense Sologrid Pilot Project — Using decentralized artificial intelligence for making distribution grids resilient
Authors: Andreas Ulbig, Daniel Cajoos, Michel Gasche, Marc Laeser, S. Koch, René Hoffmann, R. Schärer, M. Staudinger, F. Ferrucci, G. Albisetti, D. Galli
Abstract summary: The paper describes a pilot project using decentralized AI for resilient distributed energy management in a residential distribution grid.

Title: How disruptive artificial intelligence solutions can enhance safety of field operations in the electrical sector
Authors: A. Iaccarino, C. Gaitán Poyatos, F. Chiovoloni, N. González Gómez, S. d'Angelo, J. Petruzzi
Abstract summary: Enel is using AI to automatically recognize dangerous situations and risky behaviors during field activities in the electrical sector to improve worker safety.

Title: FUSE – using artificial intelligence in the energy grid of tomorrow
Authors: T. Vögele, C. Backe, M. Bande, P. Conradi, P. Hovila, K. Kauhaniemi, H. Kumar, Timo Kyntäjä, Matti Rita-Kasari, Muhammad Shafiq, Stefan Werner, C. Wiezorek
Abstract summary: The FUSE project is developing AI methods to increase the resilience of future energy distribution grids, including for condition monitoring and distributed demand-side management.

Title: Impact of Artificial Intelligence on the Planning and Operation of Distributed Energy Systems in Smart Grids
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the impact of AI on planning and operation of distributed energy systems in smart grids, but does not specifically address AI assistance for utility field crews.

Title: Accelerating Artificial Intelligence on the Grid
Authors: S. Murphy, Kevin D. Jones, T. Laughner, M. Bariya, A. von Meier
Abstract summary: This project aims to accelerate the development and deployment of AI solutions for the electric grid by addressing gaps in data, tools, and people.

Title: Remote Assistance through Augmented Reality for the Electric Power Workforce
Authors: Paula Zenni Lodetti, D. V. João, M. A. Martins, J. F. B. Almeida
Venue: 2021 Asian Conference on Innovation in Technology (ASIANCON)
Abstract summary: The paper evaluates the use of augmented reality for remote assistance to improve the efficiency of the electric power workforce.

Title: Towards an AI Assistant for Power Grid Operators
Authors: Antoine Marot, Alexandre Rozier, Matthieu Dussartre, Laure Crochepierre, Benjamin Donnot
Abstract summary: The paper proposes an AI assistant framework to help power grid operators manage the increasing complexity of power grids.
